channel.title: Working with GridWeb on Aspose.Cells Product Family
channel.description: Recent content in Working with GridWeb on Aspose.Cells Product Family

item.title: Add GridWeb to Web Form
item.description: This topic provides a basic step by step guide for beginners to help them create and use the Aspose.Cells.GridWeb control in web applications. Contents Summary 1 Creating & Using Aspose.Cells.GridWeb Control 1.1 Step 1: Creating a Web Application Project 1.2 Step 2: Embedding Control to the Web Form 1.3 Step 3: Resizing Control 1.4 Step 4: Setting Control Properties 1.4.1 Custom Command Buttons 1.5 Important 1.6 Step 5: Running Web Application

item.title: Apply Styles to GridWeb
item.description: Aspose.Cells.GridWeb has its own default look & feel but it is possible to change its appearance. Aspose.Cells.GridWeb provides several properties to let developers fully control its appearance. This topic discusses some of those properties. Contents Summary 1 Applying Preset or Custom Styles to Aspose.Cells.GridWeb 1.1 Preset Styles 1.2 Header Bar Style 1.3 Tab Bar Style 1.4 Reusable Customized Style File 1.5 Saving Style File 1.6 Loading Style File

item.title: Resize GridWeb and its Header Bar
item.description: Add GridWeb to Web Form, discussed resizing the Aspose.Cells.GridWeb control using WYSIWYG. This article explains how to do the same thing but at runtime using the Aspose.Cells.GridWeb API. It also explains how to resize the header bars of the Aspose.Cells.GridWeb control to make their data easier to read. Contents Summary 1 Changing Width & Height of Aspose.Cells.GridWeb 1.1 Changing Width & Height of Header Bar | Changing Width & Height of Aspose.

item.title: Import Microsoft Excel File
item.description: Like Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop, Aspose.Cells.GridWeb control can open and load Microsoft Excel files - complete with data, formatting, charts, images etc. - but in web applications. This topic explains how. Contents Summary 1 Import Excel Files 1.1 Import from File 1.2 Import from Stream | Import Excel Files Import from File To open an Excel file using Aspose.Cells.GridWeb control: Add the Aspose.

item.title: Export Microsoft Excel File
item.description: It is possible to create new, or manipulate existing Microsoft Excel files, on websites in GUI mode using Aspose.Cells.GridWeb control. The files can then be saved to Excel files. Aspose.Cells.GridWeb effectively serves as an online spreadsheet editor. This topic describes how to save grid content to Excel files. Contents Summary 1 Export Excel Files 1.1 Export as a File 1.2 Export as a Stream | Export Excel Files Export as a File

item.title: Enable Different GridWeb Modes
item.description: This article describes Aspose.Cells.GridWeb’s different modes. These modes are differentiated logically due to their different features and behaviors. We have identified several types of mode: Edit Mode View Mode Session Mode Sessionless Mode All of these modes have their own characteristics. Developers can work with Aspose.Cells.GridWeb in any mode according to their requirements. We’ll look at each mode below. Contents Summary 1 Edit Mode 2 View Mode

item.title: Working with GridWeb Events
item.description: All programmers must be familiar with events and their purpose. Events are used to send notifications of changes that may occur in a control or class. Aspose.Cells.GridWeb has several events that can be used to perform specific tasks when certain changes occur in the control. This topic provides an introduction to all events supported by the Aspose.Cells.GridWeb control along with some details on how to handle these events. Contents Summary

item.title: Working with GridWeb Double Click Events
item.description: Aspose.Cells.GridWeb contains three types of double-click events: CellDoubleClick, fired when a cell is double-clicked. ColumnDoubleClick, fired when a column header is double-clicked. RowDoubleClick, fired when a row header is double-clicked. This topic discusses how to enable double-click events in Aspose.Cells.GridWeb. It also discusses creating event handlers for these events. Contents Summary 1 Enabling Double Click Events 2 Handling Double Click Events 2.1 Double Click Cell

item.title: Print GridWeb
item.description: There are times when developers need to print the GridWeb contents from a web page without saving the result as Microsoft Excel spreadsheet file. The Aspose.Cells.GridWeb control supports this feature via client side function. Printing GridWeb In order to print the contents, the Aspose.Cells.GridWeb for .NET has exposed the GridWeb.Print client-side function which can be used in a JavaScript call as demonstrated below. \ \ Once the JavaScript function is in place, it can be triggered on any event of choice.

item.title: Create Custom Command Buttons
item.description: Aspose.Cells.GridWeb contains special buttons like Submit, Save and Undo. All these buttons perform specific tasks for Aspose.Cells.GridWeb. It is also possible to add custom buttons that performs custom tasks. This topic explains how to use this feature. Contents Summary 1 Creating Custom Command Buttons 1.1 Event Handling of Custom Command Button | Creating Custom Command Buttons To create a custom command button in Aspose.

item.title: Enable GridWeb EditBox
item.description: The GridWeb’s Edit Box is a toolbar that is rendered at the top of control that you can use to see/enter or copy data/formula into cells. It also shows the cell’s name which you are editing. After clicking the frame or when you start writing data or type an equal (=) symbol, the Edit Box will be activated. Setting the Edit Box of Aspose.Cells.GridWeb The GridWeb control provides the ShowCellEditBox property to which developers can assign it to “True” to make the toolbar on.

item.title: Get GridWeb Release or Version
item.description: Please use the Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.GridWeb.GetVersion() method to get the release or running version of Aspose.Cells.GridWeb. This version will help you to find the GridWeb version on run time through code. Contents Summary 1 Get the Release or Running Version of Aspose.Cells.GridWeb 2 Find the version number of client side script file of GridWeb | Get the Release or Running Version of Aspose.Cells.GridWeb The following sample code finds the running version of Aspose.

item.title: Add or Remove Context Menu Items in GridWeb
item.description: You can add context menu items using ASP.NET markup or using the .NET code. You can also remove context menu items using the .NET code. Please use GridWeb.CustomCommandButtons.Add() and GridWeb.CustomCommandButtons.Remove() or RemoveAt() methods for these purpose. Contents Summary 1 Add Context Menu Item using ASP.NET Markup 2 Add Context Menu Items in Aspose.Cells.GridWeb using Code 3 Remove Context Menu Items in Aspose.Cells.GridWeb using Code | Add Context Menu Item using ASP.

item.title: Execute client side function on GridWeb page change
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Execute client side function on GridWeb page change 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios Sometimes you need to execute your client side function when GridWeb page changes. Aspose.Cells.GridWeb provides the OnPageChangeClientFunction property for this purpose. Please set this property with client side function which you want to execute. Execute client side function on GridWeb page change

item.title: Set Column Header Tip
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Setting Column Header Tip 3 Sample Code || Possible Usage Scenarios You might need to set tooltip for your custom column while creating the table in the worksheet. Aspose.Cells.GridWeb allows you to rename a column’s caption and you may set tooltip to the column, so the users could easily understand what is the column for.

item.title: Working of GridWeb when ASP.NET Session state mode is SQL Server
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Working of GridWeb when ASP.NET Session state mode is SQL Server 3 Sample Web.Config Session State Settings 4 Reference Article | Possible Usage Scenarios This article explains working of GridWeb when ASP.NET Session state mode is SQL Server. Working of GridWeb when ASP.NET Session state mode is SQL Server If you want to use SQL Server or StateServer to hold sessions, use GridWeb Session Mode.

item.title: Render Interactive Scrollbar in GridWeb
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Render Interactive Scrollbar in GridWeb 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios Aspose.Cells for GridWeb can render interactive scroll bar control inside the GridWeb worksheet. User can interact with the scroll bar like they do in Microsoft Excel. In order to create interactive scroll bar, you must add the links for jQuery and jQuery UI libraries as shown below.
